recipe-ingredients: 1/2 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
1/3 cup (1-3/4 oz.) dried cranberries; more for garnish
recipe-preparation:
Position a rack in the center of the oven and heat the oven to 350°F. Line 12 standard-size muffin cups with paper liners.
Bring 1 cup water to a boil, remove from the heat, stir in the tea, and steep for 5 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing to extract as much liquid as possible.
In a 2-quart saucepan, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Stir in the brown sugar and honey, and set aside to cool.
In a food processor or large bowl, combine the flour, ginger, and salt, and pulse to blend. Scrape in the butter mixture and blend. Add the eggs, vanilla, and orange zest and process until combined.
Stir the baking soda into 1/2 cup of the tea. Add to the batter along with the cranberries, and pulse. Portion the batter among the muffin cups, filling each about full. Bake, rotating halfway through, until a toothpick inserted in the center of the muffins comes out with moist crumbs clinging to it, about 15 minutes. Cool in the pan on a rack. Once cool, remove the muffins from the pan.
In a small bowl, combine the confectioners’ sugar with 1 Tbs. of the remaining tea. Whisk, adding more tea 1 tsp. at a time as necessary to make a thick but pourable icing. Drizzle over the cooled muffins, sprinkle with a few dried cranberries, and let set about 15 minutes before serving. The muffins are best the day they’re baked.
